div.p: God with us, along with greetings to you, your and my old humble, yet willing service. I have nothing special to write to you.
My gracious lord has kept his steward in Heidelberg.

The cities of Nuremberg, Bamberg, Würzburg are supposed to take a nobleman, who has harmed Würzburg, into his castle, against which perhaps Saxony is preparing to oppose, in case the elector might be taken back, etc. Therefore, I cannot keep it from you in silence, that when I was greeted by you, I heard from Doctor Hans zum Bock, from Sultzer, and also from Doctor Martin Peyer, that many are asking whether some princes, Palatinate, Saxony, Württemberg, Hesse, and then 4 cities might want to enter into a peace with you, much is being said about whether this should be considered in advance.
I have orally instructed my son to report to you at length, as you see fit, you will inform me. I will hurry back to you.
With greetings from the housemother and everyone.
Done on the 17th of January in the year 1564. Your entirely willing Johann Vogler.
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger etc. to his own hands.
